poem:
**Balancing Acts**

In the margins of a schedule,  
a student shuffles time—  
books stacked like hopes,  
hours sewn into pockets.  
  
In the café hum,  
between the steam of espresso  
and the mumble of pages,  
the future's resume is typed,  
one shift at a time,  
inked in dreams.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How to manage a part-time job alongside your student workload … and boost your CV at the same time If you’re planning to go to university, you may also be thinking about getting a job while studying. But it can be difficult to know where to look, especially if you’re moving to an unfamiliar city. The most important thing is to find a job that’s flexible enough to fit alongside your studies. With the third". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
